title: I know, I know it was so foolish of me not To retain an Attorney but I didn't have the funds. ?
question: I have been living in my home for pretty close to 20. Years and transfer to more loan servicer than I can count, But I. Haven't paid a house payment in close to 9 years!! I have countless notice of Default sent to me but they were all postpone or sold to another company. I had been ask bye Litton if I had the original loan documents,, I replied yes and then they ask me to send a copy of them??I don't think that would be something I should do? Right ?Now I have another Notice of Default! and I applied for the loan modification,while at the same time I was sending TONS! Of paperwork! I wanted to reinstate the loan but now there telling me I am days. Away from the sale date auction! nd that was like 2 months ago, is there anyway I can get an attorney to try an reinstate the chapter 13?or is it really to late? Sale date Jan 30 2019
answers: If there is any chance you need to go see an attorney ASAP

You need to call some experienced bankruptcy attorneys right away for a consultation. You can likely re-file a chapter 13 to stop the sale date. There are various options regarding your chapter 13 plan as the arrears are likely very high if you have not paid the mortgage for 9 years.
Possibly. Consult with some real estate attorneys to review all documents and communications. If you have been living mortgage free for nine years it sounds like you can afford an attorney.
